content.p: 'Conferencing the International' was a major five-year AHRC funded project (2015-2020). It examined liberal, imperial and radical forms of internationalism as manifested in their conferencing spaces between the wars. Drawing from archives across three continents, the project reconstructed the local, national and global geographies of three important groups of interwar conferences: The key aim of the project was to closely examine the new breed of international conferences that emerged in the post-1918 world so as to investigate what internationalism was, how it was experienced, and what it achieved.
